snippet: A deadly bomb exploded during a ceremony on Wednesday at the newly reopened National Theater in the Somali capital as the prime minister was addressing the guests.
abstract: Bomb explodes during a ceremony at the newly reopened National Theater in the Somali capital of Mogadishu as the prime minister is speaking; incident turns an event that had been a welcome sign of growing calm into a grisly reminder of the troubles still plaguing the country; four people, including two prominent sports officials, are killed, though authorities say the prime minister, Abdiweli Mohamed Ali, was unhurt.

byline.original: By MOHAMMED IBRAHIM and J. DAVID GOODMAN
byline.contributor: Mohammed Ibrahim reported from Mogadishu, and J. David Goodman from New York.

lead_paragraph: A deadly bomb exploded during a ceremony on Wednesday at the newly reopened National Theater in the Somali capital as the prime minister was addressing the guests.

headline.seo: Deadly Theater Blast Shatters Calm in Somalia
headline.main: Deadly Blast Shatters Calm in Somali Capital
headline.print_headline: Blast at Newly Reopened Theater Shatters Somali Capital’s Calm
